Title: Natural resources minister presses case for Canadian LNG exports to Europe
Description: At a news conference wrapping up a trip to Berlin, Natural Resources Minister Tim Hodgson said German companies have told him they are interested in Canadian liquefied natural gas, and that his government wants to meet that demand.

Title: Russia’s Arctic LNG 2 Hits Record Output as Ice Conditions Ease
Description: Russia’s Arctic LNG 2 project lifted production to record levels in late August as summer ice conditions opened the Northern Sea Route, allowing additional cargoes to reach Asia, according to Bloomberg data reported by LiveMint. Output topped 25 million cubic…

Title: Canada's LNG draws German interest for market swaps, minister says
Nat-Gas Prices Surge on Expectations of Lower-Than-Normal Inventory Build
Canadian LNG bound for Europe by 2032, energy minister says
Description: His comments breathe life into a stalled 2022 plan, as tensions simmer between the U.S. and Canada and Europe.

Title: EQT in talks with NextDecade for LNG Supply, Bloomberg News reports
US Gas Driller EQT Is in Talks With NextDecade for LNG Supply
Description: US natural gas driller EQT Corp. is in talks to take a supply of liquefied natural gas from NextDecade Corp.’s export terminal, which is being built in Texas.

Title: Technip Energies Awarded FEED Contracts for INPEX Abadi LNG Project in Indonesia
Description: Technip Energies (PARIS:TE), in consortium with JGC, has been awarded two significant Front-End Engineering Design (FEED) contracts for INPEX Abadi LNG project, a landmark development for Indonesia’s energy landscape located in the Masela Block.

Title: Russia’s Sanctioned Arctic LNG Plant Boosts Output to New Record
Description: Russia’s sanctioned Arctic LNG 2 project boosted gas output to record levels this month as the export facility keeps loading cargoes that have struggled to find buyers.

Title: Canada interested in supplying LNG to Germany: Hodgson
Description: Canada is interested in supplying Germany with LNG, provided there is demand and Canadian infrastructure can be built. Read more.

Title: Gas demand rises 22% in July amid higher electricity generation
Description: Moneypoint’s coal-fired operations ceased in June

Title: China Set to Extend LNG Import Decline
Description: China is expected to see in August its tenth straight month of falling LNG imports from a year earlier, as pipeline gas supply and domestic production rise. Chinese LNG imports are set to drop by 9% in August from a year earlier, to about 5.93 million tons, a…

Title: Ukraine Looks To US Gas Imports As Russia Switches Focus Of Attacks
Description: When a swarm of 39 Russian drones attacked a compressor station in southern Ukraine this month, it was a sign of how Russia has shifted the focus of its attacks on Ukraine's energy infrastructure.

Title: Gas demand rises in July as coal exits generation mix
Description: Gas demand surged in July as Ireland marked its first month in over four decades without coal contributing to electricity generation after the closure of the Moneypoint power station in Co Clare in June.

Title: Carney’s Energy Chief Rebukes Trudeau Over LNG Policy in Europe
Description: Canadian Energy Minister Tim Hodgson said his government is taking steps toward exporting natural gas to Europe, and criticized former Prime Minister Justin Trudeau for not making the same effort.

Title: Vitol's former Asia LNG lead joins ExxonMobil to head global LNG trading
UAE’s Adnoc Expands LNG Sales With 15-Year India Supply Deal
Description: The biggest oil producer in the United Arab Emirates agreed to supply liquefied natural gas to Indian Oil Corp. for 15 years as it lines up more binding contracts for a new export terminal.

Title: GXO and B&Q on Track to Meet Ambitious Zero Emissions Targets by 2040
